User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the application.

fcmToken.description: The Firebase Cloud Messaging token for push notifications.

Device.title: Device
Device.description: Represents a device owned by a user, including its settings and connection information.

deviceId.description: The unique device identifier for the device hardware.

userId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N Device). The ID of the user who owns this device.

name.description: A descriptive name for the device (e.g., 'My Blue Device').

ledEnabled.description: Indicates whether the LED on the device is enabled.

leftBehindNotificationEnabled.description: Indicates whether left-behind notifications are enabled for this device.

leftBehindDistance.description: The distance threshold (in meters) for a left-behind notification.

latitude.description: The last known latitude of the device.

longitude.description: The last known longitude of the device.

temperature.description: The last recorded temperature from the device.

windspeed.description: The last recorded windspeed from the device.

condition.description: The last recorded weather condition from the device.

NotificationLog.title: NotificationLog
NotificationLog.description: Represents a log entry for a notification sent to the user.

id.description: Unique identifier for the notification log entry.

userId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N NotificationLog). The ID of the user who received the notification.

deviceId.description: Reference to Device. (Relationship: Device 1:N NotificationLog). The ID of the device associated with the notification (if applicable).

timestamp.description: The date and time the notification was sent.

WeatherAlertPreference.title: WeatherAlertPreference
WeatherAlertPreference.description: Represents a user's preferences for weather alerts.

id.description: Unique identifier for the weather alert preference.

userId.description: Reference to User. (Relationship: User 1:N WeatherAlertPreference). The ID of the user who owns these preferences.

city.description: The city for which to receive weather alerts.

rainAlertEnabled.description: Indicates whether rain alerts are enabled.

temperatureAlertEnabled.description: Indicates whether temperature alerts are enabled.

temperatureThreshold.description: The temperature threshold (in Celsius) for triggering a temperature alert.

Notification.title: Notification
Notification.description: Represents the data sent to the alert API endpoint.

userId.description: The ID of the user to send the notification to.

deviceId.description: The ID of the device the notification is for.

message.description: The content of the notification message.

UmbrellaActivity.title: UmbrellaActivity
UmbrellaActivity.description: Represents a log of umbrella activity.

id.description: Unique identifier for the activity log.

firestore.reasoning:
The Firestore data structure is designed to ensure security, scalability, and ease of debugging, following the principles of Authorization Independence, Clarity of Intent, DBAC, and QAPs. User-owned data is stored under the `/users/{userId}` path, providing clear ownership and simplifying security rules. Denormalization is used to avoid `get()` calls in security rules, ensuring atomic operations and making rules easier to understand.  All collections are structurally segregated based on access needs.

*   **Authorization Independence**: Achieved by storing user-specific data (Devices, NotificationLogs, WeatherAlertPreferences) directly under the `/users/{userId}` collection, thus eliminating the need for hierarchical authorization and `get()` calls in security rules.
*   **QAPs Support**:  The structure supports secure `list` operations by ensuring that each collection maintains a homogeneous security posture.  For example, only the authenticated user can access their own `/users/{userId}/devices` collection, and global roles are managed by existence checks in dedicated collections. Path-based ownership ensures the ability to secure `list` operations.

The schema focuses on path-based ownership for private data (Devices, NotificationLogs, WeatherAlertPreferences).
